meanings.definition: A painting or drawing in a single color.
meanings.sent1: The artist's monochromes were all in shades of blue.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed several monochromes by famous artists.
meanings.sent3: The room looked like a sea of monochromes, with every wall painted in the same color.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe resembled a collection of monochromes, mostly in black and white.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the monochromes made them stand out among the colorful artworks.

meanings.definition: A photograph or picture developed in black and white or in varying tones of a single color.
meanings.sent1: The photographer's monochromes captured the essence of the city in black and white.
meanings.sent2: She admired the beauty of monochromes in photography.
meanings.sent3: The family portrait turned out to be a monochrome, as the camera malfunctioned.
meanings.sent4: The monochromes in the gallery evoked a sense of nostalgia in the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The monochromes of the old town brought back memories of simpler times.
